title: Cons momentum-leaking sand truck speed-time graph

content.question: A truck of mass <math alttext="m sub uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>T</mtext></msub></math> is initially at rest with a load of sand of initial mass <math alttext="m sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>s</mtext></msub></math>. At time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the truck is pushed forward by a constant force <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and the sand begins to leave the truck, as shown. The mass of sand that has left the truck as a function of time <math alttext="lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="C times lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, where <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> is a positive constant with appropriate units. At time <math alttext="lowercase t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> there is no sand left in the truck. Which of the following graphs most nearly shows the velocity <math alttext="v sub uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>T</mtext></msub></math> of the truck as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “lowercase t, and the value lowercase t sub 1 is indicated in the middle of the axis. The vertical axis is labeled “v sub uppercase T,” and no values are indicated along it. A vertical dashed line is drawn through lowercase t sub 1. The line begins at the origin, slants upward and to the right, intersects the dashed line above lowercase t sub 1, and ends near the top of the vertical axis and at the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a line graph in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “lowercase t, and the value lowercase t sub 1 is indicated in the middle of the axis. The vertical axis is labeled “v sub uppercase T,” and no values are indicated along it. A vertical dashed line is drawn through lowercase t sub 1. The line graph has two line segments. The first line segment begins at the origin, slants upward and to the right, and ends as it intersects the dashed line above lowercase t sub 1. The second line segment begins where the first one ends, moves horizontally to the right, and ends slightly below the middle of the vertical axis and at the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “lowercase t, and the value lowercase t sub 1 is indicated in the middle of the axis. The vertical axis is labeled “v sub uppercase T,” and no values are indicated along it. A vertical dashed line is drawn through lowercase t sub 1. The curve begins at the origin and is approximately horizontal. It curves upward and to the right, slowly at first and then more rapidly, then intersects the dashed line above lowercase t sub 1. The curve continues past the dashed line, but slants upward and to the right linearly, and ends slightly above the middle of the vertical axis and at the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “lowercase t, and the value lowercase t sub 1 is indicated in the middle of the axis. The vertical axis is labeled “v sub uppercase T,” and no values are indicated along it. A vertical dashed line is drawn through lowercase t sub 1. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, slowly at first and then more rapidly, then intersects the dashed line above lowercase t sub 1. The curve continues past the dashed line curving upward sharply, and ends at the top of the vertical axis and at the end of the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “lowercase t, and the value lowercase t sub 1 is indicated in the middle of the axis. The vertical axis is labeled “v sub uppercase T,” and no values are indicated along it. A vertical dashed line is drawn through lowercase t sub 1. The curve begins at the origin and is approximately horizontal. It curves upward and to the right, slowly at first and then more rapidly, then intersects the dashed line above lowercase t sub 1. The curve continues past the dashed line, but slants upward and to the right linearly, and ends slightly above the middle of the vertical axis and at the end of the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
